conclusion: Understanding the relationship between power source, resistor, and graph characteristics
Power source's output power is calculated using P = VI
Power source's output power is proportional to the product of current and terminal voltage
Line I represents power source's output characteristics with voltage on vertical axis and current on horizontal axis
Line II represents resistor R's characteristics with voltage on vertical axis and current on horizontal axis
Use P = VI formula and values from line I to find power
Voltage V for line I is 3 V and current I is 2 A
Output power P is 3 x 2 = 6 W
Assume power source's output power is same as power of resistor due to lack of specific values for resistor
Output power of power source is same as power of resistor, which is 6 W
The output power of the power source is 6 W
